title: [Large-Scale] AI-Based Real-Time Classroom Interaction Analysis and Optimization Strategies: Mathematical Modeling Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Mathematics education theories and project-based learning (PBL) experience, basic AI technology comprehension, and foundational probability/statistics and data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Real-time interactive data analysis and instructional strategy improvement using AI tools in BYOD environments, focusing on interaction network modeling via graph theory and matrix operations

learning_goals: Learners classify classroom interaction patterns (student-teacher, student-student, student-object, no interaction) with ≥ 90% accuracy using AI-based interaction tracking systems and mathematical classification algorithms.
Learners adjust in-class teaching strategies ≥ 3 times by processing real-time interaction data with probability distributions and statistical analysis.
Learners propose ≥ 1 PBL activity design improvement plan applying mathematical optimization techniques based on one-week interaction logs.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
